snippet: Norman Mailer, Hunter S. Thompson, Garry Wills and Michael Lewis are some of the authors who have provided peeks behind the curtain of American presidential campaigns.
abstract: Norman Mailer, Hunter S. Thompson, Garry Wills and Michael Lewis are some of the authors who have provided peeks behind the curtain of American presidential campaigns.
lead_paragraph: Michael Lewis's book about the 1996 presidential election, "Trail Fever" (since republished as "Losers"), includes this description of the attendees at a banquet for Republicans in New Hampshire: "Every ounce of being they have left over after pledging allegiance to the United States and singing the national anthem goes into despising the United States government."

headline.main: Old Page Turners for a New Presidential Campaign
